definition[0]: to take something or someone illegally from one country to another
example[0]: The guns were smuggled across the border.
example[1]: Illegal immigrants are smuggled into the country by boat.
definition[1]: to take something or someone secretly to a place where they are not allowed to be
example[2]: He smuggled his notes into the exam.
example[3]: They caught her trying to smuggle drugs into France.
example[4]: The silver was found in Yugoslavia and smuggled out.
